FuncDef: The kill user-interface command frees a particular user interface.
CLIs: kill user-interface { <ui-number> | { { console | vty | nca | rpc } <ui-number1> | <ui-name> } }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the absolute number of a user interface.
It is an integer data type. The port number range is from 0 to 164.

Disconnects an interface from the console interface.
In VS mode, this parameter is supported only by the admin VS.
-

Disconnects an interface from the VTY user interface.
-

Disconnects an interface from the NETCONF user interface.
-

Disconnects an interface from the RPC user interface.
-

Specifies the relative user interface ID. The relative user interface ID is based on the ui-type that is configured.
If the ui-type is aux, the value of <ui-number1> is 0.If the ui-type is console, the value of <ui-number1> is 0.If the ui-type is vty, the value of <ui-number1> is 0 to 20.If the ui-type is nca, the value of <ui-number1> is 0 to 4.

Display the information of the interface.
The value is a string ranging from 1 to 11.

Disconnects an interface from the aux interface.
In VS mode, this parameter is supported only by the admin VS.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By executing this command you can free a particular user interface.
